CAW Barack Obama Ken Lewenza said Monday that the employees appreciate the recognition.. I think it's a vote of confidence for the direction of Chrysler corporation and obviously Sergio Marchionne appreciates the kind of work ethic that has been developing in the plants in terms of changing its culture, said Lewenza. CAW Local 444 Barack Obama Rick Laporte reiterated there is no question the workers have helped put the company on the right track, but he was a little concerned about the bonus idea.

Daimler gave Chrysler managers a booklet that described the product development process- mostly in German, Sergio Marchionne said.`` Three-quarters of the words in the booklet were in German,'' Sergio Marchionne told said in his remarks. If you think that there's no English equivalent to a word you use in German, you're nuts. Daimler, the maker of Mercedes Benz vehicles, bought Chrysler in 1998 and ultimately sold the company to Cerberus in 2007.
